rome.title: Rome
rome.gettingThere: Fly to Fiumicino (FCO) or Ciampino (CIA). Leonardo Express train to Termini station in 32 minutes.

essentials.gettingAround: Metro (3 lines), buses, and walking. 72-hour transit pass costs EUR 18.

florence.title: Florence
florence.gettingThere: Fly to Florence Airport (FLR) or take high-speed train from Rome (1.5 hours) or Milan (1 hr 40 min).

essentials.gettingAround: Entirely walkable centro storico. No need for transit.

venice.title: Venice
venice.gettingThere: Fly to Marco Polo Airport (VCE). Alilaguna water bus or ATVO bus to city center.

essentials.gettingAround: Vaporetti (water buses) and walking. 72-hour pass EUR 40.

milan.title: Milan
milan.gettingThere: Fly to Malpensa (MXP) or Linate (LIN). Malpensa Express train to Centrale station, 50 min.

essentials.gettingAround: Excellent metro system (4 lines). Single ticket EUR 2.20, 24-hour pass EUR 7.60.

naples.title: Naples
naples.gettingThere: Fly to Naples International (NAP). Alibus shuttle to Piazza Garibaldi, 20 min.

essentials.gettingAround: Metro Line 1, walking, Circumvesuviana train to Pompeii/Sorrento.

amalfi-coast.title: Amalfi Coast
amalfi-coast.gettingThere: Fly to Naples (NAP), then SITA bus or ferry from Salerno. Drive the SS163 coastal road.

essentials.gettingAround: SITA buses between towns, ferries May-October, or hire a driver.

cinque-terre.title: Cinque Terre
cinque-terre.gettingThere: Train from La Spezia Centrale. High-speed trains connect La Spezia to Florence, Milan, Rome.

essentials.gettingAround: Cinque Terre Express train (EUR 16/day card). Ferries April-October.

tuscany.title: Tuscany
tuscany.gettingThere: Base in Florence or Siena. Rent a car for the best Tuscan experience.

essentials.gettingAround: Rent a car — essential for hilltop towns. Watch for ZTL restricted zones in town centers.
trainConnections: Florence to Siena (1.5 hr by bus)

sicily.title: Sicily
sicily.tagline: Island of Fire and Ancient Wonders
sicily.gettingThere: Fly to Palermo (PMO) or Catania (CTA). Ferries from Naples or mainland also available.

essentials.gettingAround: Rent a car — trains are slow and buses infrequent.
trainConnections: Internal rail between Palermo, Catania, Syracuse, Taormina

sardinia.title: Sardinia
sardinia.gettingThere: Fly to Cagliari (CAG), Olbia (OLB), or Alghero (AHO). Ferries from mainland 5-12 hours.

essentials.gettingAround: Rent a car — essential. Public transport very limited.
trainConnections: Internal Trenitalia between Cagliari, Sassari, Olbia

bologna.title: Bologna
bologna.gettingThere: Fly to Bologna Airport (BLQ). Monorail to central station. High-speed trains from all major cities.

essentials.gettingAround: Compact centro storico, all walkable. 40 km of covered porticoes.

lake-como.title: Lake Como
lake-como.gettingThere: Train from Milan Centrale to Como or Varenna (1 hour). Then ferry between lakeside towns.

essentials.gettingAround: Ferries connect all major towns. Car ferry between Bellagio-Varenna-Menaggio.

pompeii.title: Pompeii
pompeii.gettingThere: Circumvesuviana train from Naples Garibaldi station (35 min, EUR 3.60).

essentials.gettingAround: The site is 170 acres. Rent audioguide EUR 8 or join a guided tour.

positano.title: Positano
positano.gettingThere: SITA bus from Sorrento (40 min) or ferry from Naples, Amalfi, or Capri.

essentials.gettingAround: Walking (many stairs). Internal orange bus EUR 1.30 between upper road and beach.

verona.title: Verona
verona.gettingThere: High-speed trains from Venice (1 hr), Milan (1.5 hrs), Bologna (1 hr).

essentials.gettingAround: Compact centro storico, all walkable within 20 min. Bike rental EUR 10/day.
